intro: Scabiosa holophylla, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for alpine environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Scabiosa holophylla is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
